properties.description: This pipeline runs historical files from drop zone for Oracle FIS_Data table.
This will run pipelines from FD and FIS Source System data

activities.name: Execute FISCardHolder
activities.description: Must run after FD (no truncation in FIS)

activities.name: Update Cardholder Client Number
activities.description:
Affects both FIS and FD
run u_Cardholder_Update_Client_From_BIN
to correct bad clientnumbers

properties.description: connect to AppODS and get data

activities.name: connect_AppODS
activities.description: connect to Application ODS and get all digital transactions and update the fact transaction flag

properties.description: Process to create Shared Branch monthly Summary data
Process to create Shared Branch daily Summary data
Account, Cardholder and client piepelines to be called from master pipeline. Added McycleCardholder.

Deprecated - Replaced by PL_DropToRaw_Container.

This process monitors the control file used for Drop to Raw movement and reruns every hour to find files that were not moved properly

source.sqlReaderQuery:
Select max(load_date) as load_date from [audit].[transactions_log]
where sf_loaded_to_semantic = 1
and run_id in (Select distinct run_id from [transaction].[fact_transaction])

Select min(load_date) as load_date from [audit].[transactions_log]
where sf_loaded_to_semantic = 1
and run_id in (Select distinct run_id from [transaction].[fact_transaction])

Select DATEADD(month,-13,max(load_date)) as load_date from [audit].[transactions_log]
where sf_loaded_to_semantic = 1
and run_id in (Select distinct run_id from [transaction].[fact_transaction])

properties.description: Generic Pipeline to Copy files from the drop-zone to raw.

ErrorMsg.value: @concat('Date Parsing Failed for ',pipeline().parameters.FileName,'.  Please check to make sure the file name did not change and that the date substring information is correct in the config file.')

errorCode.value: @concat('Expected file did not meet the size requirements. Possible 0 byte file. Location: drop-zone/',variables('Source_Directory'),'/',pipeline().parameters.FileName)
